trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux nxFileLine Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux nxFileLine Resource

trans-unit.source: The nxFileLine resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to to manage lines within a configuration file on a Linux node.
trans-unit.target: The nxFileLine resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to to manage lines within a configuration file on a Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: FilePath
trans-unit.target: FilePath

trans-unit.source: The full path to the file to manage lines in on the target node.
trans-unit.target: The full path to the file to manage lines in on the target node.

trans-unit.source: ContainsLine
trans-unit.target: ContainsLine

trans-unit.source: A line to ensure exists in the file.
trans-unit.target: A line to ensure exists in the file.

trans-unit.source: This line will be appended to the file if it does not exist in the file.
trans-unit.target: This line will be appended to the file if it does not exist in the file.

trans-unit.source: ContainsLine is mandatory, but can be set to an empty string (`ContainsLine = ‘’``) if it is not needed.
trans-unit.target: ContainsLine is mandatory, but can be set to an empty string (`ContainsLine = ‘’``) if it is not needed.

trans-unit.source: DoesNotContainPattern
trans-unit.target: DoesNotContainPattern

trans-unit.source: A regular expression pattern for lines that should not exist in the file.
trans-unit.target: A regular expression pattern for lines that should not exist in the file.

trans-unit.source: For any lines that exist in the file that match this regular expression, the line will be removed from the file.
trans-unit.target: For any lines that exist in the file that match this regular expression, the line will be removed from the file.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates using the nxFileLine resource to configure the /etc/sudoers file, ensuring that the user: monuser is configured to not requiretty.
trans-unit.target: This example demonstrates using the nxFileLine resource to configure the /etc/sudoers file, ensuring that the user: monuser is configured to not requiretty.
